alert.note: Alert for Klamath Basin and the Fremont-Winema National Forest (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 29 at 1:32PM PDT until July 29 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM PDT SATURDAY FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND AND LOW RH FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 624, 625, 284, and 285... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH HAS BEEN CANCELLED, ALTHOUGH CRITICAL HUMIDITIES AND BRIEF GUSTY WINDS ARE STILL POSSIBLE... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND AND LOW RH FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 285 AND 624... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IS CANCELLED FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND AND LOW RH FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 285 AND 624... * AFFECTED AREA...In California...Fire weather zone 285 for all areas, except the southwest corner around the community of Day. In Oregon...Fire weather zone 624 including the Fremont- Winema National Forest and the communities of Lakeview, Bly, and Bonanza. * WIND...Southwest to west, 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * HUMIDITY...9 to 15 percent through the afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Critical RHs will continue Sunday afternoon. Winds may gust to criteria at times, but not persistently enough for a Warning, so have cancelled watch. * DETAILED URL...View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Avoid tossing burning cigarettes on the ground, parking hot vehicles on dry vegetation, and using equipment that can cause sparks. Follow all fire restrictions. Find links to restrictions at weather.gov/medford/wildfire. One less spark, one less wildfire. Gather your fire evacuation kit now. Collect essentials you don`t want to lose and prioritize your checklist. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. Familiarize yourself with your evacuation plan. Where will you go? How will you get there? Who will you call to let others know your are safe? Visit ready.gov/wildfires for more information. A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. These conditions promote rapid spread of fire which may become life threatening. Evacuate if ordered to, or if a fire threatens.

area.areaDesc: Klamath Basin and the Fremont-Winema National Forest
